title: Can I get reported for muting everyone at the start of the game?
body:
My account is in danger of a permaban because of my toxic behavior and I don't want to try my luck. The only solution is to just mute everyone. Can I get reported for it though?

No, I am not judging anyone to be guilty before they even talk, but a friend of mine LITERALLY got permabanned (he was toxic in the past but he stopped after the 14-day) because he was talking with his friend in League because they couldn't get on skype (it was one of the chat logs Riot provided).

I have read the stories where people can say just the tiniest thing and they get reported and I do not wish to try my luck.

Thanks.

replies.body:
While Necromancy may be handy (and sometimes needed) in video games, it's not the case for old forum threads. Please avoid using such magic and be mindful of how old threads are before posting.

Feel free to contact us at the [Moderation Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/230113905668653056/306220435262144512) or at [Discuss the Boards]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) for any questions, comments or concerns about this. Thank you and have a good day.

[In the words of Riot Tantram: ](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/unobngtr-how-player-behavior-penalties-affect-hextech-crafting?comment=00000000000000010001000200000000000000000001) "You cannot ever be punished for saying nothing .. unless of course it's for something gameplay related like feeding, afking or cheating. But, you can never be punished for offensive language, hate speech or verbal abuse if you said nothing."

As long as you are communicating with pings, you are still communicating with your team.  There is no rule that says you have to talk to your team.  It might be a good idea to let the team know in the beginning of the match that you are muting.  You don't have to say it in a bad way, but just giving them a head's up, so they will know not to expect verbal replies from you.  "Hey guys, I'm really going to be focusing this match, so I'm muting chat.  But don't worry, I'll still be pinging!  Talk to you all in the post-game."
No, fuck the chat. I am serious. I don't want to use it EVER again. After my last ban I have lost all faith. I will just mute everyone and ping for communication.
i feed u bro
I think I will just tell people in champ select. Thanks for your time, brother.

Best of luck to you!  As one of the people who spends a lot of time here on the PB&M boards, it's always nice to see people coming here before a punishment.  You're on the right track!  Now just stick with it, and good luck on the rift.

> The only solution is to just mute everyone. Can I get reported for it though?

You CAN get reported for chat related offenses, the reports just won't do anything. You can't get punished for a verbal offense if you didn't type.

> I have read the stories where people can say just the tiniest thing and they get reported and I do not wish to try my luck.

This is simply not true. As long as you use chat for its intended purpose, you wont get penalized for anything.

> After my last ban I have lost all faith.

Do you think your last ban was unjustly applied?

First of all, Thank you for taking the time to reply to me. I appreciate it.

1) Alright, so do I have your "approval" to mute everyone as soon as we enter the game? Trust me, I have played this game for a very, very, very long time and I cannot hold my anger sometimes.

2) Thanks again for clearing it up. Maybe I am being paranoid

3) Yes and No. 

The chat logs in my 10 game chat ban were COMPLETELY justified. I was being an ass, I got what was coming to me.

In the 25 game chat restriction, 1 of the 2 games was a 3v3 ranked flex Q between me and my friends. We were just chilling around on skype laughing our butts off and then one of my friends goes "watch this" and tells the enemy team to report me for flaming. I thought nothing of it and then I saw the chat logs. In the other game, I was being a crybaby because my lane was getting camped. Sad life.

The 14 day suspension though is my biggest gripe. I was playing Flex on my own and I was telling my jungler "please don't ignore me, come gank" and "at least say no". He was solo as well. This player that was mid was premade with the 2 bot laners and around the 30 minute mark, after constantly, non-stop flaming our jungler she said "Rengar and Udyr, go afk". At that point, I lost it. Her friend was 0/8 and she decided to blame me for losing so I told her "SHUT UP, THIS ENTIRE GAME YOU HAVEN'T STOPPED, JESUS". After that, she just started to say "enjoy ban". I reported both her and her toxic team (the 0/8 AD carry was flaming the enemy AD carry), didn't get any notifications when the suspension was finally finished today.  In my opinion, this game and the game in which I was with my friends should NOT have been applied. I may be wrong.

In the other chat log I was provided with on the 14 day suspension, I was on my promos and I got an AFK Riven. I just lost my shit in that game.

So, I'll ask again. For a "toxic" player like me, would you advise muting everyone as soon as we enter the game, provided I let my team know on champ select and yet still communicate with pings?

Thank you for your time, Tantram. Just seeing a Rioter reply made my day a bit better.

EDIT: In the 25 game chat restriction I was talking about, we were writing curses in the chat. Forgot to mention that.

> So, I'll ask again. For a "toxic" player like me, would you advise muting everyone as soon as we enter the game, provided I let my team know on champ select and yet still communicate with pings?

Just type '/mute all' as soon as the game loads.
All is good.
